name: Classic Beef and Spinach Lasagna
ingredients: 2 jars (approx. 500 g each) tomato-based pasta sauce
2-3 jars (approx. 470 g each) béchamel sauce (e.g., Dolmio)
200 g fresh or frozen spinach (thawed and squeezed dry if frozen)
Lasagna pasta sheets (fresh or no-boil, approx. 250-300 g)
Salt, pepper, and dried oregano (to taste)
Optional: 150-200 g grated mozzarella or parmesan for topping
instructions: In a large pan, brown the minced beef over medium-high heat. Drain excess fat if needed.
Add chopped onions, carrots, and garlic. Cook for 5-7 minutes until softened.
Stir in the spinach and cook until wilted (if using fresh) or heated through.
Pour in the two jars of tomato sauce, season generously with salt, pepper, and oregano. Simmer for 10 minutes.

In a large baking dish, start layering: spread a thin layer of meat sauce on the bottom, cover with lasagna sheets, then a layer of béchamel sauce, followed by more meat sauce. Repeat layers (usually 3-4 layers total), finishing with a generous layer of béchamel on top.
Optional: sprinkle grated cheese over the final béchamel layer.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and bake an additional 15-20 minutes until golden and bubbling.
Let rest for 10-15 minutes before cutting and serving.
